head.supplied: Melbourne, 10th April 1890 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ In accordance with your instructions I have the honor, to submit herewith Estimates of expenditure for my branch of the Service for 1890/91. As you will perceive,...

div.p: P90/4250, unit 513, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by G. Luehmann and signed by M. Melbourne, 10th April 1890

In accordance with your instructions I have the honor, to submit herewith Estimates of expenditure for my branch of the Service for 1890/91. As you will perceive, there is a reduction of £67.-for Salaries as compared with the financial year 1889/90, while the sum for Contingencies is the same.
See also M to T. Wilson, 16 June 1890.
I have the honor to be,

p.seg: Estimates of Expenditure for the Year ending 30th June, 1891
